fields.summary: Update BUILDER_PATH_LABEL in Maven2Builder

fields.description: If you are moving a lot of builds, there is a lot that needs to be done so it might actually take a while.  Meanwhile the browser times out the request and the user gets left with a 500 error (or similar) wondering whether it worked or not.  We should handle this better.
fields.summary: Browser times out request before Move builds task has finished.
New autocomplete widget for picking plans in gadgets

fields.description:
I've been trying to create an elastic Windows instance for use by Bamboo by adapting the instructions for Linux. 

I've got it to the point where Bamboo tries to start an Windows EC2 instance. It seems to take much longer to start a Windows AMI than a Linux one. Bamboo gives up and shuts down the instance before it's finished starting. 

There needs to be a way to configure that timeout.
fields.summary: Timeout for starting an elastic instance should be configurable

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1) Go to Build Configuration
2) Click on the Builder tab
3) Click 'Edit Plan'
4) Should open the builder tab in edit mode
5) click save or cancel on the form
6) you should have been redirected to the 'Plan Details' view tab
7) click 'Edit Plan'
8) should have been redirected to the edit Builder tab
fields.summary: Build Configuration Tabs still broken

fields.description:
Similar to the feature to exclude modules or files from change detection bamboo should have a feature to 
exclude files and directories from being deleted during the 'clean working copy' operation before checking out.
fields.summary: Option to exclude artifacts from a working copy clean operation
Make it possible to use multiple resource bundles for assertKeyPresent methods
Test that WebRepoUrl gets pulled down correctly
Update Elastic building doc

* No IE6

Under IE7 the buttons pane will over-run the size of the dialog (affects add JDK / add Builder)

* Need to test in all supported browsers.
* Inline JDK, Builder, Mail, IM
* Ping Anton for VM

Import from Maven should enable dependency blocking and maven 2 dependency feature

* Redirect to Builder config. section in Edit mode

** Should be a param that sets the cookied & the selectedTab

* Only affects UI on setup wizard

fields.summary: Problem when importing a plan from Maven for a second time

fields.description: We need to review the driver notes for all JDBC drivers that we support
fields.summary: Supported driver notes are incorrect for standalone

fields.description:
If a plon has been executed a number of times and has tests, but none of these tests have failed, the tabs:
# Top 10 most failing tests
# Top 10 longest to fix tests

say:

bq. There have been no test cases identified in this build for Last 25 builds. 

That is not true, as there are tests. There are simply no failing tests.

We need to reword the message such that it reflects the criteria of the tab.

The problem is that the above 2 tabs are the first to show up, and the user could be very confused thinking that no tests were found at all. Which is not, thankfully, the case.
fields.summary: The wording on the first 2 tabs on the Test part of the View Plan screen is wrong when there are no tests found that fit criteria

fields.description:
Going to the http://{myserver}/browse/user/{username} URL,by e.g. clicking the username in the header, results in an empty page.

Brydie says this happens only when the user is not associated with a SCM user.
fields.summary: The public profile page is broken when the user is not associated with a repository user

fields.description:
Need to:
# Remove versions from the "Oracle" database selection menu. We now support 10g and 11 g and not 9i. Versions are not mentioned for any other databases so should remove them for oracle as well
# Remove the "Unsupported Database" from the database drop down *unless* the "bamboo.enable.unsupported.db" *System Property* is set to true. This will allow users who really need this to set the system property and go ahead, but be aware that they are not supported
# Create a link to supported database page in the documentation from the Choose a Database Configuration section of the Setup Wizard
fields.summary: Cleanup Setup Wizard for new supported Databases
Artifact "Clover Report (System)" is added even if the Clover is not enabled

fields.description: * Should go to view version of the artifacts screen
fields.summary: When editing plans "Done" button in artifacts doesn't work
The contact administrators link should not be available is the setup footer

fields.description:
* Deleting from list page currently uses JS popup
* Prefer JS popup but fine to add confirmation screen (just be consistent with each other)
* Should work with the class="confirmationRequired"
* Fix wording o be conssitent
fields.summary: Removing build results from a menu should have a confirmation screen

fields.description:
A new event was added in Bamboo 2.5 called the ServerStartedEvent

The classes name is com.atlassian.bamboo.event.ServerStartedEvent

This event is fired when the Server has finished starting eg, bamboo has connected to the database, initialised all plugins and local agents have started.
fields.summary: Documentation for ServerStartedEvent

fields.description:
Since bamboo.js has been converted to use AJS the setup wizard no longer works.

The following should be done to complete this story:
* jquery and raphael should be included in the setup wizard header only. When bamboo is not in setup these javascript files should not be available. (move jquery and raphael to js/setup to differentiate them from the rest of the bundled js).
* remove dependance on bamboo.js.
fields.summary: Remove the setup wizards dependance on AJS and bamboo.js

fields.description:
It often becomes hard to keep track of which version of this is used by which version of that. File fingerprinting simplifies this.
Projects need to be configured to record fingerprints of build artifacts.
fields.summary: File Fingerprinting

fields.description:
I have a build that runs the same unit tests multiple times with different classpaths.
As the test names are the same I store the test results (TEST.*.xml) files in different directories so one does not overwrite other.

I would like to be able to tell Bamboo about all those dirs so that I can see test results from multiple runs.

When com.foo.BarTest passes in pass 1 (result in /testcases1) but fails in pass 2 (result in /testcases2) I would like to see both results on the dashboard, esp. the latter.
fields.summary: Multiple sets of unit test results per build (multiple test directories)

fields.description:
I would like to be able to automatically perform a manual process I sometimes do:
{code}
ant build.something
[if passed]
ant build.something.else
[if passed]
ant deploy.the.result
{code}

The point is that step2 operates on results of step1 - no clean in the mean time.

I would like each step to have separate UI in Bamboo as if it was a normal standalone build.
In my case, ant build.something builds the jars and performs unit tests, build.something.else just does exactly the same unit tests but with different classpath.
fields.summary: Incremental (phased) builds
Add note in plan permission advising users that global admins have all permissions

fields.description:
The configured per plan permission 'Build' is not applied.
The plan can still be manually triggered.
fields.summary: Plan permission 'Build' is not applied as selected

fields.description: When I uncheck the "The build will produce test results." checkbox, and then save, and then edit again, the checkbox is still checked, and so if the build doesn't have a JUnit test XML file, the build will always fail.
fields.summary: Cannot configure a build that doesn't produce test results

fields.description:
An update in a plan's builder spec is not reflected in the plan's requirements.
For example after changing the JDK from 1.5 to 1.6 in the builder spec the requirements tab will still show 
JDK 1.5
fields.summary: Plan requirements are not updated after builder JDK has been updated.
Plan summary not saving "refresh interval"
Charts not saving "group by" & "refresh interval"

fields.description:
In Confluence, Bamboo gadgets render a pencil icon, that displays an edit menu when clicked, however, the edit menu is not visible to Confluence users preventing them from making edits.

This occurs in pages as well as the macro browser.
fields.summary: Clicking on the pencil icon does not do anything useful

fields.description: Wrapped build plan name text is not indented from build plan check boxes, making readability difficult.
fields.summary: Bamboo Plans gadget: indent build plan text for better usability

fields.description:
# Go to OAuth Admin screen
# Enter "https://qa-eac.atlassian.com" to consumer base URL field
# click "Add" button

Attempt to add consumer fails. Error message displayed is "Server responded with an error"

Error message should be more informative/useful
fields.summary: Unhelpful error message displayed for failed attempt to add OAuth consumer in Bamboo

fields.description:
x-axis for chart shows timeframe from 30-Sep to 30-Oct yet tooltips displayed when mousing over chart display either:
# "chart" which is useless or
# statistics for November which is outside the timescale of the chart

Also the position of the cursor that generates these tooltips appears to be random.
fields.summary: Bamboo Plan Summary Chart gadget: tooltips wrong or useless
Bamboo Plan Summary Chart gadget: config drop down menus too big for container in Confluence MacroBrowser

fields.description:
Bamboo charts gadget was added to Confluence (qa-eac), however qa-eac is not an authorised container on the Bamboo instance providing the gadget, resulting in the error message in attached screenshot displayed in Confluence's macro browser.

The problem with this message is that it doesn't inform the user which system needs to be administered to resolve the error. Presumably in this case it's the Bamboo instance serving the gadget, but as the error is displayed inside Confluence, undoubtedly it's the Confluence admins who'll be contacted.
fields.summary: Bamboo gadget's unauthorised container error message unhelpful

fields.description:
In both the macro browser and pages, a padlock icon is displayed to users for each Bamboo gadget.
There is no accompanying explanation or explanatory tooltip. Clicking it does nothing.
It's presence is therefore confusing to end users.
fields.summary: Unexplained padlock icon displayed by Bamboo gadgets in Confluence
My Bamboo tab should not appear when user is not logged in

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to QA-JAC and add a Bamboo gadget hosted from JBAC.
2. Configure the gadget and user can see a chart showing all data.
3. Click on the chart.

Result:
1. It give user internal error message as its unable to find png file. Complete log file is attached.

Expected:
1. No internal server error, the clicking of graph should be handled more gracefully.
fields.summary: Clicking on the bamboo chart in chart gadget in JIRA dashboard give user "Internal Server" error message

fields.description:
Instructions for the Bamboo charts gadget

Steps:
1. Login to QA-JAC and add bamboo chart gadget hosted on JBAC.
2. In the preferences window, select the builds,select "Group By" as weekly,show builds from as "last 30 days" and refresh interval as "Every 30 mins". Save it.
3. It display the chart with desired build and group by weekly info.
4. Click to any other dashboard or any other menu of JIRA and back to the dashboard having bamboo gadget.

Result:
1. The chart is different, opening the preferences dialog show "Group By" and "Refresh Interval" is reset to default and not getting saved.

Expected:
1. The preferences for gadget should be saved.
fields.summary: Some gadgets not saving certain fields after refreshing the page

fields.description:
I tried using the new inline creation of a builder and JDK in the create/edit plan wizard in IE7 and it didn't work correctly.

I tried editing a plan and clicking the 'Add new builder' link. Bamboo displayed a blank modal screen, then after a few seconds it displayed a login screen. When I logged in it did display the correct fields, but on the main window not in a modal screen. 

_Edit: I tried repeating this again and it seems to work, since I have logged in previously (via the modal window). The modal window is cropped though and cuts off half of the bottom buttons._
fields.summary: Cannot add new Builder/JDK inline when creating/editing a plan n IE7

fields.description:
My plan fails as follows:

{quote}
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] BUILD ERROR
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Failed to resolve artifact.

Missing:
----------
1) com.cenqua.clover:clover:jar:2.6.2

  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.

  Then, install it using the command: 
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.cenqua.clover -DartifactId=clover -Dversion=2.6.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file

  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there: 
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=com.cenqua.clover -DartifactId=clover -Dversion=2.6.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]

  Path to dependency: 
          1) com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-clover2-plugin:maven-plugin:2.6.2-r2
          2) com.cenqua.clover:clover:jar:2.6.2

----------
1 required artifact is missing.

for artifact: 
  com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-clover2-plugin:maven-plugin:2.6.2-r2

from the specified remote repositories:
  central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2)
{quote}

There is no settings.xml in effect, and no mention of Clover in any of my POMs.
fields.summary: Maven 2 project with automatic Clover integration can't find Clover

fields.description:
How does Bamboo detect a build failure when using Maven? We are using Maven 2.x for most of our builds and everything works fine. In Maven 2.x builds:
1. The process returns with a 0
2. The text "BUILD SUCCESSFULL" appears at the last few hundred lines of the logs

However, we need to to use an alpha version of Maven 3 for some code metric generation. In Maven 3.x builds:
1. The process returns with a 0
2. The text "BUILD SUCCESS" appears at the last few hundred lines of the logs

Bamboo looks for a very specific string in the logs and it ends up categorizing all Maven 3 builds as failures.

Is there a way to configure that or disable the 2nd success detection rule?
fields.summary: Build failure detection for Maven 3 - BUILD SUCCESS

fields.description:
This equally applies to Confluence, when it comes to locating presence.

It would be very useful for the instant messenger connector (based on jabber/jive) to be plugable.

For example, We use Microsoft OCS internally, and there are of course many others (yahoo, google, msn ...)

I am not suggesting that Atlassian builds all these connectors, but instead define API points for integrating these connectors into bamboo and confluence, or infact any of your products.

Core functionality required:
1. Chat in and out (for bamboo, and jira)
2. Presence (for confluence)

Surely this API should be the same for each of your products, so integrators can build once, and deploy for all.

As of now, it is possible (but hard), to replace the XMPP connector for bamboo. This should all be abstracted to the plugin framework.
fields.summary: Allow the unified communication (IM) connector to be a plugin
Better handling of "Attic" in web repository viewers.
Update doc for -Dfire.initial.build.for.manual.strategy flag for manual strategy

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20091117-mbtn8ufg3kkb3552s73cm9ax7q.jpg!

fields.description:
JSON data which is returned from the builds rest api service is incorrect. Please see screenshots.

Example: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/build/CRUC.json?expand=builds.build
fields.summary: REST: Incorrect representation of JSON data
Dashboard no longer rembers project's Collapse/Expand

fields.description:
Please add a function to remove OAuth tokens from Bamboo.

This is already implemented in JIRA, if that's a helpful reference.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+OAuth+Consumers#ConfiguringOAuthConsumers-RemovinganOAuthconsumer
fields.summary: Add a function to remove OAuth tokens in Bamboo

fields.description:
When adding/configuring Bamboo gadgets using Confluence's macro browser, a spinner briefly appears but disappears before updates from the Bamboo provider are completed. This:

# Causes confusion when the gadget is not rendered correctly but the "insert" button is no longer greyed out
# Can cause mis-configured gadgets to be inserted into pages when the " insert" button is clicked too early

Users should be advised of updates still in progress (spinner, or progress bar etc) and prevented from inserting gadgets before they are configured
fields.summary: Bamboo gadgets provide no feedback whilst updating (which can be very slow for high number of build plans etc)

fields.description: * http://skitch.com/markhrynczak/n84yk/bamboo-plans-gadget-on-ie6
fields.summary: Bamboo plans gadget is giving a JS error in Confluence

fields.description:

fields.description: In our environment we have to create a number of different plans per project, to handle the different build steps and promotions. Creating the builds for each plan via the GUI is tedious and error-prone, so it would be very useful to have a REST API for plan creation (and updating). I can't seem to find any remote API's on this aspect of configuration, though..
fields.summary: Rest API for editing and creating plan/job

fields.description:
Some builds are more important than others so wouldn't it be great to be able to define a 'weight' for every plan?
Reordering manually is a step in the right direction, but being able to pre-define the order would be even better!

Thanks
fields.summary: Add a priority in the build plan configuration

fields.description:
Just installed v4.0#466 and imported data (xml) from 3.12.3-#302.
In version 3 we used JIRA Bamboo Plugin (v 2.1) and I'm happy to see that the Jira/Bamboo integration now is a part of the base system.

Problem: 
In the project view, under "Builds" there is a listing of builds associated with the project.
The links (to Bamboo) for some builds are incorrect. There is an extra "0" added at the end of the build number. "RELEASE-NT-15" becomes "RELEASE-NT-150".
It seems to only affect builds that are older than a month.
fields.summary: Links to Bamboo builds are incorrect

fields.description: Bamboo should offer a feature that allows the user to specify multiple repositories to checkout from, along with destination directories to where those repos will be checked out. Hudson has this functionality, which was yet another deciding factor to choose it over Bamboo.
fields.summary: Customizable and multi-repository SVN checkouts

fields.description:
A deciding factor between CI tools for us was the ability for developers to be able to trigger builds at-will over XMPP in addition to scheduled builds. 

Unfortunately, Atlassian has lost $8k from us, as we have decided to go with Hudson, since their ability to trigger builds via XMPP has proven more valuable than Bamboo's outstanding integration with Jira.

However, if this feature is developed in the near-term, we may reconsider purchasing Bamboo.
fields.summary: XMPP-based Build Triggering

fields.description: This error continiously spewes into the logs

You can still disable the agents via the admin panel

fields.description: It would be great if Bamboo will accumulate all changes between the first failed build and and first successful build.
fields.summary: Accumulation of changes between builds

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem:

1-) Make sure that you are not logged in Bamboo.
2-) Access page http://localhost:8085/admin/updateLicense!default.action
3-) Try to update the license.

The Update works.

*The problem doesn't happen in Bamboo 2.5*. accidentally fixed in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-4491

2.5 code:
{code}
<action name="updateLicense" class="com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.AdminUpdateLicenseAction">
      <interceptor-ref name="globalAdminStack"/>
{code}
2.4 code:
{code}
<action name="updateLicense" class="com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.UpdateLicenseAction">
{code}
(without interceptor)
fields.summary: Bamboo license can be updated by any user
Parse pom.xml details
Checkout pom.xml from specified repository

fields.description: The useOAuth parameter is set to "always" which is causing this. It should be set to a REST endpoint that provides information about the current user.
